reviewText:
This specifically reviews the game played in English.

If you are going to sell a game as a visual novel, you should copy edit your text and review your translations. I can not speak for any of the other languages, but the English translation for Snow Light is embarassing. Not only does the vast majority of the script read like it was run through Google Translate without revision, it has enough typos to clearly indicate the writer/translator did not even bother to use spell check.

The terrible writing is not the only thing that muddles this story. The game uses so many acronyms that it can be difficult to keep track of them all. Some exist in the real world, some are made up for the game, but they all run together to combine with the incoherent translation in making the story extremely hard to follow.

The art ranges from appearing decent to looking like something a teenager threw together in Microsoft Paint. In some cases you can tell the artist reused a face asset which makes a character look like a mishapen freak of nature with two mouths.

The text is not always accompanied by sound. During my playthrough there were a number of long durations of text exposition that occurred in either total silence or with just some ambient white noise. The game has no voice acting, and most of the game sounds are just cheesy stock-sounding gunfire noises.

The interactive aspect consists of approximately ten quick time events that appear without warning and involves seemingly random keypresses. You never know when to expect them, what key you will have to press (either once or quickly in repetition), and they have a very short input window. When you fail the game goes back around 5 seconds for you to do it again once you know to expect it. Luckily you only lose those few seconds each time, since you will most likely fail them all at first (they also pop up at the top of the screen while you are reading the dialogue at the bottom). There are also two branching options that the player can choose from, but they appear to only affect a specific scene each and does not have any affect on the larger narrative.

The narrative itself, as difficult as it is to follow, ends as if this is the first chapter in an episodic game.  I don't know if this is the developer's plan, but even if it is, do not expect much satisfaction from the story. There are much better visual novels available on Steam. I suggest you exhaust as many other options as possible before purchasing this.

reviewText:
I only played this visual novel for a couple of minutes. Not because the story is bad, it starts out pretty good to be honest. But, there're just some serious grammar failures and some serious artwork errors.
I'll write a more complete review later, but at this moment I can't get myself to reading more of it and as such I do NOT recommend it at this moment.

Alright, I booted the game again. (Almost a year later) and although the developers said that they would fix the translation problem.., it's still a brutal mess. Most of the time I'm just so frustrated by trying to fix the mess I read on screen, it makes me feel like I'm taking somekind of grammar test; Detect the 15  failures in the small block of text." That's how bad it is. This shouldn't even be released on Steam."

reviewText:
I have an IQ of about 300, so I often do not fit ito the social with other people. This led me to be depression, and I feel I'm too smarter for peple to understand. A goal that I thought would be playing video games until I am too dumber and then I would be happier. I feel tat I would better suit my friends then. It was a good plan. And then I'll be happier.

So I play Snow Light. Snow Light is a game about the future where many wars and battles and wars occur between the many letters of factions, suh as UNECA, SAUN, AJNA, ASIS, DAAP, CAAP, ETC, etc. I do not know what all these letters mean because they mix everything together after a while, but please do not confuse them, because it is important for the stry to make sense. The name of Snow Light is not Snow Liht. Not her first or her last name. It is Catherine Anna Delbtos Da Verrone. She is shoot bullet faster than the speed of light, so her code name. And is light boots. But it is also caled Katy. The game is mainly about her puruit of White Maks, which typos very often in his talks, like spelling whenm and hae. I think about who is White Mask, you might find other people who typos lot, and it would suspicioun.

To do this, Snow Light trvels to far away places in the world, and QTEs many many many people. My favorite was the Favalas Tiger Man. And Menkens. You also get to play naked Rebecca in two points. She has sexy, but I still like Snow Light beter. And there is fat man. You are going to South America, which is not in USE, and Russias, and England, and other locaions. I will not spoilers but ahahah, there are many spies and doble cros and names named Lisa ahahah.

Graphic are good, especialy during the battle scenes where whole screen shakes, 1080p. And there is a helicoptor. There are a few bugs, which plays in cineatic talks before it happens, but it gets you used to ignore half of what is said in any case, it is not too bad. QTEs are in Visual Novel, and you may be asking WHY, but it is important for the high scoe. It adds replays. Can you make 0 QTE fails? Play again and again.

All in all, I would say my test was success. My IQ now is 82. So I am much less intellident. I fit in with friends lots better, ahahah. Somteimes they look at me weird because I have hard time forming complete and understanding sentnces, but I am much happier because I played Snow Light. You play Snow Light too. You be happier.

Remember: Do it quickly and use synchronisation.

>tfw Dragon and Weed will never be grenlit ;_;

reviewText: This is a different type of game that takes a little getting used to. This is more like playing a graphic novel with sub-titles that you have to read. This has decisions that you have to make that could affect the game play. Once I got used to the style of the game it isn 't that bad. The game is not for everyone. The game can use more attention. Yes I do recomend this game because it is not a common game where everything is fast moving like a RPG or FPS.
